data.meta_description: 🎉 Delighted to be recognized by JSC "National Company "KazMunaiGas" for contributing to the successful launch of the first commercial oil and gas production…
data.text:
We are thrilled to share the video from our Book Launch and Award Ceremony event in Luanda, marking the unveiling of the highly anticipated publication, "The Energy Year Angola 2023." We extend our sincere gratitude to our esteemed sponsors, NOSSA Seguros and Grupo Simples, for their role in realizing this endeavor. The event also featured an Awards Ceremony, where The Energy Year’s team distributed nine awards honouring individuals, companies and projects for their exceptional contributions to the domestic market over the past year. ANPG Angola president Paulino Jeronimo was selected as the Person of the Year for outstanding commitment to promoting transparency, spearheading multiple reforms and improving regulation of the Angolan oil and gas business environment. Additional award winners recognised during the ceremony include: Somoil - Sociedade Petrolífera Angolana S.A.* – Exploration & Production Player of the Year Tubostrans – Indigenous Company of the Year CABSHIP – Local Content Champion of the Year AES - Angola Environmental Serviços: NORM – Sustainability Project of the Year Mecwide – EPC Company of the Year Operatec Engenharia & Serviços: OMITC Academy – Training Initiative of the Year Azule Energy – Joint Venture of the Year Catoca Mining Company – Minerals Player of the Year *(Somoil was renamed Etu Energias in 2023) #TheEnergyYearAngola #BookLaunch #AwardCeremony #NosaSeguros #GruposSimple #AngolaEnergy2023 #EnergyIndustry #Innovation #StakeholderEngagement #ProfessionalExcellence

Pedo earning billions of rupees for KP: adviser PESHAWAR: Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Caretaker Adviser for Planning & Development, Energy & Power and Minerals Development Dr Syed Sarfaraz Ali Shah has said Pakhtunkhwa Energy Development Organization (Pedo) is a major source of annual income worth billions of rupees. He said that under the supervision of Pedo, work is currently underway on 42 energy projects of transmission lines including hydro and solar power. The completion of these projects would prove to be a game changer for the stability and economic development of the province, he added. https://lnkd.in/dNBW-YQe #hydro #solar #power #economicdevelopment #economy #billions #electricity #projects #transmission

𝐍𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐧 𝐒𝐮𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐫𝐚'𝐬 𝐄𝐧𝐞𝐫𝐠𝐲 𝐑𝐞𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧: 𝐅𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝐋𝐍𝐆 𝐭𝐨 𝐇𝐲𝐝𝐫𝐨𝐩𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫 🌊⚡ Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) is spearheading a transformative shift in Northern Sumatra's energy landscape. With a staggering 5 GW of untapped #hydropower potential, the region is poised to reduce its reliance on #LNG imports. The draft RUPTL 2024-2033 outlines an ambitious plan, allocating 586 MW of hydropower for North Sumatra and 1,200 MW for scattered projects across Sumatra. This strategic move not only promises enhanced electricity access for Aceh and North Sumatra but also opens up significant opportunities for private sector involvement in energy infrastructure. Dive deeper into this pivotal energy transition: https://lnkd.in/gDjHjqTZ Stay ahead of Indonesia's evolving energy landscape with Petromindo's comprehensive analysis and reports. Our expert insights keep you informed on the latest developments shaping the sector. 📊📚 #IndonesianEnergyTransition #HydropowerDevelopment #SumatraEnergy #RenewableInvestment #AseanPowerSector #EnergyInfrastructure #PetromindoInsights How will this transition impact local communities and the broader energy market? We invite industry experts and stakeholders to like, share, and join the conversation on the challenges and opportunities this shift presents. 💡🇮🇩

🌍Indonesia’s Synergy Engineering has been awarded the prestigious front-end engineering and design (FEED) contract for Repsol’s $630 million Kali Berau Dalam (KBD) Gas field development. Located in South Sumatra, this project is set to boost Indonesia’s Natural Gas production with an estimated capacity of 135 million cubic feet per day. The KBD field, part of the Sakakemang production sharing contract, includes the installation of a central processing facility, CO2 and produced water pipelines, and the drilling of two new production wells. This development underscores Repsol’s commitment to advancing Indonesia’s Energy sector, with first Gas expected by early 2028. 🚀💼 To learn more about this development, click the link in the comments below! ⬇️ #OilAndGas #EnergySector #Indonesia #Repsol #SynergyEngineering #NaturalGas #EnergyDevelopment #FEEDContract #GasProduction #SoutheastAsiaEnergy

The #InternationalPtX Hub, funded by PNUD Mauritanie, has conducted four pivotal trainings on renewable energy and renewable Power-to-X, in Mauritania. These sessions took place from 6 to 15 May and included around 60 decision-makers from the Ministry of Petroleum, Mines and Energy - Mauritania . The EITI (Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative) Mauritania hosted one of the trainings. #Mauritania is one of the most promising countries in Africa to produce low-cost green hydrogen and renewable PtX. Here is why: ➡Optimal conditions: Excellent hybrid sites with high wind and solar potential ➡Strategic location: Proximity to European markets enhances export potential ➡Established mining industry: Opportunities for green steel and iron ore production, supporting domestic #defossilisation and economic growth ➡Government initiative: Several giga-watt scale export projects announced for #greenhydrogen, ammonia, and direct reduced iron ➡Challenges: Infrastructure, water scarcity, and workforce skills In terms of outcomes, the Secretary General of the Ministry of Petroleum, Mines and Energy - Mauritania , Mr. Ahmed Salem Ould Bouhedda, highlighted the sector’s strategic importance and its potential for economic and social transformation. Additionally, the participants emphasised the need for more renewable PtX trainings. Thomas Elmar Schuppe Prof. Dr. Thorsten Schneiders

AT THE 8TH UGANDA INTERNATIONAL OIL AND GAS SUMMIT These are images from the eighth edition of the Uganda International Oil and Gas Summit uiogs2023 in Kampala. With energy the priority sector for development in Uganda, her policy on local content is unlocking many attractive opportunities for international business and investment with drilling underway at both of the country’s two commercial oil development areas - the Kingfisher and Tilenga production projects, and progression is on track for first oil production in 2025. According to the Uganda Investment Authority, the oil and gas sector has significant potential to contribute to inclusive growth in the country as it is expected to bring in investments of between US$15 to US$20 billion in the next three to five years. The summit, which featured various panel sessions and photo sessions with Prime Minister of Uganda, Rt. Hon. Robinah Nabbanja, also had an international exhibition to showcase capabilities of African players in the energy, oil and gas industry.

𝐄𝐱𝐜𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐝𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐩𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐉𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐭 𝐄𝐠𝐲𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐚𝐧-𝐄𝐮𝐫𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐚𝐧 𝐈𝐧𝐯𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐢𝐧 𝐂𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐨 𝐨𝐧 𝐉𝐮𝐧𝐞 𝟐𝟗-𝟑𝟎! 🇪🇬🇪🇺 Prime Minister Dr. Mostafa Madbouly witnessed the signing of a landmark agreement for a green ammonia production project in Damietta. This project, involving the Egyptian Petrochemicals Holding Company, Misr Fertilizers Production Company (MOPCO), Norway's Scatec, and Yara, represents a major step forward in sustainable energy and investment. The project, with an initial investment cost of around $890 million, aims to produce up to 150,000 tons of green ammonia annually. It will generate renewable energy with a total capacity of 480 megawatts from wind and solar power. The green ammonia produced will be secured by a long-term agreement with Norway's Yara. In addition to the green ammonia plant, the project scope includes the construction of a seawater desalination plant and a marine jetty for exporting green ammonia from Damietta Port, with operations expected to commence in 2027. This initiative is a significant part of Egypt's energy sector strategy, aiming to enhance the use of new and renewable energy sources, reduce carbon emissions, and establish Egypt as a green hydrogen hub. The state has provided numerous incentives and advantages to attract further investment in this promising sector. The foundation of the project company, Damietta Green Ammonia Company, marks the first company to be established electronically in Egypt, with the shareholders' agreement signed in December 2023. We're proud to be part of this innovative step towards a sustainable future! #GreenEnergy #ikshanh #echem #hydrogen #SustainableDevelopment #AmmoniaProduction #Egypt #Investment #RenewableEnergy #Innovation

The ministerial panel this morning featured key insights on the growth of climate-focused projects in the Southeast Asian region, as H.E. Bapak Tutuka Ariadji, Deputy Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources in Indonesia, stated: "The very important role of the government is to make new and attractive regulations for emissions-reducing systems, like CCUS. We need to continue to develop the infrastructure around gas". #Gastech #LNG #Hydrogen #Climatetech
